interesting_feature: Cherry blossoms line the lake in late March - wheelchair accessible paved loop with waterfowl viewing
Seattle's largest park with Puget Sound views and Olympic Mountain backdrop - lighthouse trail option
Trio of cascades pumping hard with spring runoff through mossy old-growth forest
268-foot iconic waterfall at peak spring flow - paved viewpoints and historic observation deck
Hidden 28-foot waterfall on Cougar Mountain that runs dry by summer - excellent mushroom spotting
Rocky summit bluff with Snoqualmie Valley views - has Boulder Garden Loop option for scrambling
Flat stroller-accessible loop around scenic pond with mountain reflections - perfect for families
Misty 70-foot waterfall through old-growth forest you can feel misting your face
Dramatic cliff-edge ledge overlooking Rattlesnake Lake with Mt. Si and Mt. Washington views
Lush urban forest with Ravenna Creek flowing through glacial canyon
Flat forest loop around beautiful lake - excellent fauna viewing and mushroom foraging
Paraglider launch point - watch gliders launch while eating lunch with Seattle and Mt. Rainier views
Paved rail-trail along Lake Washington - multiple access points and cafes along the route
Gorgeous forest walk along turquoise glacial river - incredibly photogenic
Twenty-two switchbacks to waterfall at full spring volume - final 0.9 miles gains 850 feet
Lake Washington shoreline walk past historic seminary buildings - very accessible
Family-friendly flat riverside walk through old-growth forest with river views
Nine waterfalls total including spectacular three-tiered 265-foot main cascade at peak flow
Wetlands and woodlands urban nature escape - excellent birdwatching
Panoramic Puget Sound views with beach access and historic prairie - wildflower displays
Dramatic cliff-edge overlook with Snoqualmie Valley views - steep but short
Short but steep summit with panoramic Mt. Rainier views - worth the effort
Calm subalpine lake through cool forest - good family destination
Steep inclines to alpine meadows with panoramic Cascade views - serious workout
Natural waterslide for kids - bring swimsuits and towels for splashing fun
Two subalpine lakes on one trail - peaceful forest walk
Extremely steep - 4000 feet gain - historic mailbox at summit for leaving notes
Short walk to Lower Falls viewpoint - great for families wanting waterfall experience
125-foot waterfall with natural waterslide section - bring water shoes
Classic Seattle hike with relentless grade - Haystack summit has sweeping Snoqualmie Valley views
Quiet alpine basin emerging from snow - wildflower fields beginning
First major alpine lake of the season with waterfall views - sitting at base of Mt. Pilchuck
Nearly 1000 ft/mile climb to historic fire lookout cabin with Mt. Rainier panoramas
Subalpine lake with skunk cabbage blooms and Mt. Pilchuck backdrop
Alpine lake with wildflower meadows and waterfall along the trail - good swimming
Dramatic waterfall and alpine lake beneath 3000-foot Mt. Index cliff face - spectacular combo
Two subalpine lakes with wildflower fields - easier Mt. Rainier option
320-foot waterfall (tallest in the park) through forest walk with steady climb
Most popular alpine lake in Washington - crystal teal water surrounded by jagged peaks
Gentle alpine loop with face-to-face Mt. Rainier views through wildflower meadows
Alpine lakes and historic lookout tower with stunning Mt. Rainier views
Peak wildflower meadows and glacier views at Paradise - arrive before 8 AM on weekends
Panoramic park views from subalpine meadows - moderate terrain

Teal alpine lake past Denny Creek waterslide - steepest I-90 hike at 2700 ft gain
Alpine lakes and sub-alpine meadows with Mt. Baker views - family-friendly option
Multiple alpine lakes including Mazama and Iceberg with Baker and Shuksan views
Cascade Pass plus Sahale Glacier views - technical inclines over loose rock and gravel
Paved accessible trail to dramatic viewpoint of Mt. Baker and Mt. Shuksan - peak wildflowers
Alpine Lakes Wilderness forest walk with switchbacks to quiet mountain lake
Gateway to the Enchantments - turquoise water beneath Dragontail and Colchuck peaks
Short but steep with high alpine subalpine flowers - dramatic for minimal distance
Historic 1931 fire tower with high alpine meadows and panoramic peak views
Summit fire lookout with views of all 5 volcanoes - relatively short and close to Seattle
Endless mountain peaks and alpine lake views with spectacular vistas
Close-up Mt. Shuksan west face and glacier views - alpine meadows bloom through August
Spectacular wildflower display - lupine and paintbrush carpet meadows with 360 views
Turquoise alpine lake at 6254 feet under Liberty Bell granite spires

Panoramic Seattle and Mt. Rainier views from Tiger Mountain summit
Very steep final miles to alpine meadows with Baker and Shuksan glacier views
Easiest alpine lake in North Cascades - gentle walk to forested lake basin
Emmons Glacier viewpoint with marmots and late-season alpine wildflowers
Glacier-carved terrain with soft tundra meadows and dramatic granite formations - permit required for overnight
Packed gravel path with Mt. Si views - excellent for fitness hiking or biking
Repeat option - fire lookout with five-volcano views and shorter approach
Steep all the way with rocky and slippery sections - technical summit scramble
Late-season visit to popular alpine lake - fewer crowds than earlier in summer
Two peaceful subalpine lakes as summer winds down
Late summer repeat with less crowded trails - classic Seattle challenge
Labor Day easy option with two subalpine lakes and wildflowers
Repeat from July with different late-season wildflowers and fewer crowds
Labor Day at Paradise with late-summer alpine conditions
Quiet end-of-summer visit with peaceful reflection views
Late-season alpine lake with changing colors beginning
Pre-larch visit with early fall colors appearing
End of summer waterfall walk - still flowing well

Late fall challenge with dramatic moody lighting and fewer crowds

Late-season alpine challenge - check conditions before attempting
Post-Thanksgiving urban stroll - waterfowl and fall leaves
